results.title: The Queen of Sheba
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Famous women of the past”.
Strange and dramatic pages from the lives of the world’s most famous women. The Queen of Sheba having heard of King Solomon’s wisdom, travels across the desert to Jerusalem to meet him. The journey is one of the greatest overland journeys in history. On her arrival, the King greets her with majestic splendour, cordiality and hospitality. After a six-month stay, the Queen decides to return home. Following a sumptuous banquet in her honour, King Solomon tricks the Queen and satisfies his lust for this woman of great beauty and deep intelligence. The Queen of Sheba returns home and gives birth to a son. King Soloman never sees the Queen again but does finally meet his 16 yeaer old son, who later becomes the King of Abyssinia.

results.title: Delilah
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Famous women of the past”
Aided by the art of famous painters, this documentary tells the tail of Delilah, the biblical character, outcast and lover of Samson. Victim of savage gossip, she is burnt to death by Samson’s jealous Philistines.

results.title: Cleopatra and Antony
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Famous women of the past”.
Cleopatra, Queen of Egypt, friend and lover of Caesar, Roman Emperor. He is murdered, but she has a son, Caesarion. She is determined to have Caesar’s nephew, Octavian, (Emperor of Rome), removed and Caesarean in his place. To help the process she tries to befriend Mark Antony, the great Roman warrior. Antony succumbs to Cleopatra, and their relationship becomes unbreakable. Antony declares war on Rome to bring Caesarion to the throne - but after ten years of war, does not succeed, and their tragic deaths soon follow.

results.title: Cleopatra
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Famous women of the past”.
A narrated account of Cleopatra’s war against her younger brother, Ptolemy, and her later influence on Julius Caesar. The film uses paints of historical events and classical music adds dramatic effect.

results.title: Joan of Arc
results.brief_description:
The story of Jeanne d’Arc as told by popular imagery and paintings.

Credits: Director, Francis Lacassin ; writers, Philippe Erlanger, Francis Lacassin ; photography, Quinto Albicocco ; music, Jean Touzet ; researcher, Regine Pernoud.
Cast: Duncan Elliott, John Prim, Suzanne Aron [narration only].

results.title: Jo Jo White: offensive guard. Part 1
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
A former All-American from the University of Kansas, Jo Jo White of the Boston Celtics illustrates the various techniques of shooting usually required of backcourt men - the jump shot, shooting behind a “pick”, shooting behind a screen, shooting a layup and free throw shooting.

group_siblings.title: Jo Jo White: offensive guard. Part 2

results.title: Jack Marin: forward play. Part 1
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Willis Reed basketball series”.
Jack Marin, one of the outstanding shooters in professional ranks, demonstrates some of the shots which have helped him achieve this remarkable record. He concentrates on the jump shot, the staple of his repertoire, showing how “squaring up” the body and keeping it in line are essential, and how rolling the ball of one’s fingers is the proper release. He also demonstrates various driving moves a forward must conquer.
